API Docs#

class galaxias.dwca(occurrences: DataFrame = None, occurrences_name='occurrences.csv', dwca_name: str = 'dwca.zip', data_type: str = 'Occurrence', metadata_md: str = None, eml_xml: str = 'eml.xml', meta_xml: str = 'meta.xml')#

Bases: object

add_metadata_md(metadata_md=None)#

adds a markdown file to your dwca object. This is for if you have your own custom

Parameters:

metadata_md (str) – str containing the name of the metadata markdown file

Return type:

None

add_taxonomic_information()#

Adds full taxonomic information (from kingdom to species) to your data for clearer identification

Parameters:

None –

Return type:

None

Examples

import galaxias
import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_csv("data.csv")
my_dwca = galaxias.dwca(occurrences=data)
my_dwca.add_taxonomic_information()
my_dwca.occurrences

add_unique_occurrence_IDs(column_name='occurrenceID')#

Function that automatically adds unique IDs (in the form of uuids) to each of your occurrences.

Parameters:

column_name (str) – String containing name of column you want to add. Default is occurrenceID

Return type:

None

Examples

import galaxias
import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_csv("data.csv")
my_dwca = galaxias.dwca(occurrences=data)
my_dwca.add_unique_occurrence_IDs()
my_dwca.occurrences

check_species_names(return_taxa=False)#

Checks species names against your specified backbone. Can also give you higher taxon ranks for your taxon.

Parameters:

return_taxa (logical) – Option whether to return a dictionary object containing full taxonomic information on your species. Default to False.

Returns:

  • Either False if there are incorrect taxon names, or True. A dictionary object containing species names and alternatives

  • is returned with the return_taxa=True option.

Examples

import galaxias
import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_csv("data.csv")
my_dwca = galaxias.dwca(occurrences=data)
my_dwca.check_species_names()

True
create_metadata_file(filename=None, path='.')#

Creates a markdown file containing the metadata information needed for the DwCA. The user can edit this markdown, and use it to generate the metadata files.

Parameters:

  • filename (str) – Option whether to return a dictionary object containing full taxonomic information on your species. Default to False.

  • path (str) – File path to your working directory. Default is directory you are currently in.

Return type:

None

generate_data_report(verbose=False)#

Generate a report for the data you will submit. This currently prints out to screen, but will also render to HTML/MD (eventually)

Parameters:

verbose (logical) – Option whether to generate a simple or verbose report. Default to False.

Return type:

A printed report detailing what will need to be edited prior to data submission.

Examples

import galaxias
import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_csv("data.csv")
my_dwca = galaxias.dwca(occurrences=data)
my_dwca.generate_data_report()

make_eml_xml()#

Makes the eml.xml file from the metadata markdown file into your current working directory. The eml.xml file is the metadata file containing things like authorship, licence, institution, etc.

Parameters:

None –

Return type:

None

make_meta_xml()#

Makes the metadata.xml file from your eml.xml file and information from your occurrences / other included extensions. The metadata.xml file is your descriptor file, in that it describes what is in the DwCA.

Parameters:

None –

Return type:

None
